title: Should I use the definite article with the word 'articles'? - Quora

response.answer_text: As always, usage of definite or indefinite articles depends on context, without which any answer is meaningless. “There were articles in the NYT about this . . .” No definite article, because nothing is “defined” (or specified) in this phrase. “The articles to which I was referring were in early May . . . “ Definite article because the phrase defines/specifies which articles it refers to.
